ResourceHeader.Description: The Vanimo Ionosonde station near Vanimo, Papau New Guinea, had ionosondes since August of 1964. They are IPS 4D between 03/1995 and 10/2000, IPS 5A between 02/1991 and 12/1993, CADI between 08/1999 and 02/2006, IPS 5D since 03/1999 to 07/2009. The ionosonde information before 02/1991 is not avaiable. The IPS 5D vertical sounding ionosondes normally sweep in frequency from about 1 to 21.5 MHz. Frequency step resolution for the 5D is 5kHz, with up to 4095 steps available. The step interval is variable, becoming more coarse at higher frequencies as ionograms are generally displayed on a logarithmic scale.
